result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael J Metz
Current: 510 N Mill St., Barron, WI 54812 United States  (Effective: 11-20-2015)
Prior: Barron County Jail, Barron, WI 54812

Defendant Michael J Metz in court with attorney Andrew J Harrington.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CF200, 15CF160, 15CF141 AND 15CF134. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. Defendant waives right to PSI.

15CF134: Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1.
15CF141: Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1.
15CF160: DRI
15CF200: DRI

State makes recommendation. Defense makes recommendation.

Court relates and orders:
15CF134 Count 1: Total sentence of 3 yrs 6 months with 1 yr 6 months initial confinement and 2 yrs 0 months extended supervision concurrent with Count 1 of 15CF141.
15CF141: Total sentence of 3 yrs 6 months with 1 yr 6 months initial confinement and 2 yrs 0 months extended supervision concurrent with Count 1 of 15CF134.
BOTH IMPOSED AND STAYED.
3 yrs Probation - concurrent
Court costs on each case + DNA surcharge.
DNA sample.
Must pay child support payments in all files pending in Barron County in full and on time.
Must pay any arrears in full and on time.
Must report any change of address or employment to the Child Support Agency within 48 hours.
Must maintain full-time employment.
Must seek work if unemployed or under-employed.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
